intro: Ossaea navasensis, commonly known as the Navas' ossaea, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its striking, bell-shaped flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant typically grows in rocky or coastal environments, adapting to the harsh conditions of its native habitat. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, often forming a basal rosette. Ossaea navasensis is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
